Brown during the "Gulf of Mexico Deep Sea Habitats" expedition sponsored by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Office of Ocean Exploration, September 21 through October 2, 2003.  This track was based on the waypoints of ship's position.</abstract> <purpose>This data set was compiled in support a demonstration of the prototype NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration Digital Atlas. It was formatted for incorporation into a Geographic Information System database.</purpose> <supplinf>Information was saved in an Excel spreadsheet called  RB-03-07 transit.xls.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>20030921</begdate> <enddate>20031002</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None Planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-93.9</westbc> <eastbc>-88.0</eastbc> <northbc>30.25</northbc> <southbc>27.5</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>ship track</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>oceans</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>northwestern Gulf of Mexico</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>NOAA/NESDIS/NODC/NCDDC-National Coastal Data Development Center</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>1021 Balch Blvd., Suite 1003</address> <city>Stennis Space Center</city> <state>MS</state> <postal>39529</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>866-732-2382</cntvoice> <cntfax>228-688-2968</cntfax> <cntemail>ncddcmetadata@noaa.gov</cntemail> <hours>Monday -
